data.title: Arm Muscle Pain
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with light cardio (e.g., arm swings, jumping jacks) to increase blood flow ,do dynamic stretches for the arms, such as arm circles or shoulder rolls.

Targeted Exercises: Extend your arm straight, palm facing out. Gently pull your fingers back with the other hand. Hold for 20-30 seconds. Raise one arm overhead, bend the elbow, and touch your upper back. Use the other hand to push the elbow gently. Straighten your arm with the palm facing forward and fingers pointing down. Use the other hand to pull the fingers back gently.
Cooldown: Finish with static stretches and deep breathing to relax the muscles.
common_mistakes: Skipping Warm-Up or Cooldown: Leads to tight muscles and increases the risk of injury.
Overstretching: Can cause more harm to already strained muscles; only stretch to a comfortable point.
Rushing Exercises: Perform movements slowly to maintain control and proper technique.
data.breathing_tips: Match breathing with movement, Avoid holding your breath, Practice rhythmic breathing

data.title: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Shake out your hands gently and perform wrist rotations to loosen the joints.
Stretch: Perform wrist flexor and extensor stretches, holding each for 20-30 seconds. Include tendon gliding exercises.
Cooldown: Gently massage your palms and wrists, then perform slow wrist circles.
common_mistakes: Overstretching: Avoid pushing your wrist to painful angles.
Skipping Warm-Up: Leads to stiffness and discomfort.
Rushing Through Exercises: Reduces the effectiveness of stretches.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe deeply during each stretch and avoid holding your breath.

data.title: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Wiggle your fingers and perform light wrist rotations.
Stretch: Gently stretch the wrist flexors and extensors. Add finger stretches by spreading and contracting them.
Cooldown: Relax with slow wrist rolls and gentle palm massages.
common_mistakes: Forgetting to stretch all fingers equally.
Applying too much pressure on sensitive areas.
Skipping Cooldown: Leaves tension in the wrist and hand.
data.breathing_tips: Synchronize breathing with hand and wrist movements for better relaxation.

data.title: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome 4
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform finger taps and gentle wrist circles to increase mobility.
Stretch: Use your other hand to stretch each finger individually and extend the wrist backward gently.
Cooldown: Flex and relax your fingers several times to release tension.
common_mistakes: Stretching fingers too aggressively.
Skipping individual finger exercises.
Not performing stretches in both hands.
data.breathing_tips: Maintain a steady breathing pattern to ensure proper oxygen flow.

Stretch: Perform wrist extension stretches by pulling the palm back with the opposite hand.
Cooldown: Slowly shake out the hands to relax muscles.
common_mistakes: Neglecting to warm up both hands equally.
Overstretching into uncomfortable positions.
Skipping the relaxation phase.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale during stretches and inhale while relaxing.

Cooldown: Slowly press palms together and lower them for a final wrist stretch.

Holding stretches for too short a duration.
Forcing movements that cause discomfort.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply during preparation and exhale as you deepen the stretch.

data.title: Elbow Pain 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle elbow rotations and arm swings to increase mobility.

Targeted Exercises: Straighten your arm and gently press down on your fingers with the other hand to stretch. Bend and extend your elbow slowly, holding a light object like a water bottle. Do wrist flexion and extension exercises to support elbow muscles.
Cooldown: Stretch your arm muscles with static stretches and use a cold compress if necessary.
common_mistakes: Skipping Warm-Up: Can lead to stiff joints and reduced range of motion.
Using Too Much Weight: May strain the elbow further; use light resistance.
Fast Movements: Perform exercises slowly to maintain control and avoid pain.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe deeply and exhale during stretching or exertion to relax the muscles.

data.title: Elbow Pain 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with light cardio and gentle elbow flexion and extension exercises.

Targeted Exercises: Perform tricep stretches by raising one arm overhead and bending the elbow. Use the opposite hand to push the elbow gently. Do wrist curls with light resistance to strengthen supporting muscles.
Cooldown: Perform static stretching for the arms and wrists. Rest the elbow on a cushioned surface.
common_mistakes: Overstretching: Stop at mild tension to avoid further injury.
Ignoring Pain: If discomfort increases, stop immediately.
Skipping Rest: Allow time for recovery to avoid overuse.
data.breathing_tips: Maintain steady breathing, inhaling through the nose and exhaling during exertion.

data.title: Hand Numbness 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Shake your hands gently and perform wrist circles to improve circulation.

Targeted Exercises: Stretch your fingers wide apart and then make a fist, repeating 10 times. Press your palms together in a prayer stretch for 15-20 seconds. Stretch each finger individually by pulling it back gently.
Cooldown: Gently massage your hands and wrists, focusing on areas of numbness.
common_mistakes: Skipping Warm-Up: May reduce effectiveness of exercises.
Forcing Stretches: Stretch gently to avoid discomfort.
Holding Breath: Relax and breathe to enhance circulation.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe slowly and rhythmically to support blood flow to the hands.

data.title: Hand Numbness 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform hand-opening and closing motions to activate muscles.

Targeted Exercises: Use a stress ball to squeeze gently 10-15 times. Do wrist stretches by extending your arm with fingers pointing down, and pull back on the fingers with your other hand. Rotate your wrists in small circles.
Cooldown: Rest your hands on a soft surface and apply a warm compress if needed.
common_mistakes: Using Excessive Force: Gentle movements are key to avoid pain.
Ignoring Persistent Numbness: Seek medical advice if symptoms persist.
Skipping Cooldown: Helps reduce stiffness and promotes recovery.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply during stretches and exhale while relaxing your hands.

data.title: Muscle Aches
instructions: Warm-Up: Engage in light cardio or dynamic stretching to loosen the muscles.

Targeted Exercises: Use a foam roller to gently massage sore muscles. Perform static stretches for the affected areas, holding each stretch for 20-30 seconds. Incorporate gentle yoga poses like child’s pose for overall relief.
Cooldown: End with deep breathing exercises and light stretching to relax.
common_mistakes: Skipping Foam Rolling: Can leave knots and tension in muscles.
Overstretching Sore Muscles: Can worsen the ache; be gentle.
Ignoring Pain Points: Focus on the most affected areas.
data.breathing_tips: Practice slow, deep breaths to reduce muscle tension and enhance relaxation.

data.title: Numbness In Arms
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform shoulder rolls and arm circles to promote circulation.
Targeted Exercises: Stretch each arm across your chest and hold for 15-20 seconds. Perform gentle tricep stretches by bending your elbow overhead. Rotate your wrists and flex your fingers repeatedly.
Cooldown: Massage your arms with a warm compress to alleviate numbness.
common_mistakes: Skipping Warm-Up: May prolong numbness.
Applying Excessive Pressure: Perform stretches gently to avoid strain.
Ignoring Breathing: Steady breaths support circulation.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply during stretches and exhale to relax the muscles.

data.title: Numb Fingers
instructions: Warm-Up: Begin with gentle hand exercises, like opening and closing your fist or making circles with your fingers.

Targeted Exercises: Stretch each finger by gently pulling it back with the opposite hand. Perform wrist flexor stretches by extending your arm with your palm up and gently pulling back on your fingers.
Cooldown: End with light hand massages and shaking out your hands to release tension.
common_mistakes: Using excessive force during stretches, which can aggravate the numbness.
Ignoring pain signals, leading to further irritation.
Skipping warm-ups, which can lead to stiffness and discomfort.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe deeply during each stretch. Exhale as you stretch and inhale as you release.

data.title: Numb Hand
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform wrist rotations and finger flexing to stimulate circulation.

Targeted Exercises: Stretch the wrist extensors by placing your palm down and using the opposite hand to gently press your fingers down. Do nerve glides by making a fist and then slowly extending each finger one by one.
Cooldown: Finish with gentle wrist and finger massages to promote relaxation.
common_mistakes: Rushing through exercises, leading to poor form.
Applying too much pressure, which can exacerbate symptoms.
Neglecting consistent practice, reducing effectiveness.
data.breathing_tips: Synchronize your breathing with your movements. Avoid holding your breath during stretches.

data.title: Tennis Elbow 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Do light elbow flexion and extension exercises to loosen up the joint.

Targeted Exercises: Stretch the forearm extensors by holding your arm out straight with your palm down and gently pressing your fingers down with the opposite hand. Perform eccentric wrist curls with a light weight.
Cooldown: End with gentle forearm massages and static stretching.
common_mistakes: Using too much resistance during exercises.
Skipping warm-up, increasing the risk of strain.
Performing exercises too quickly, reducing effectiveness.
data.breathing_tips: Maintain a steady breathing pattern. Inhale during the preparation phase and exhale during the exertion phase.

data.title: Tennis Elbow 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Rotate your wrists and flex your elbows to promote blood flow.
Targeted Exercises: Perform wrist flexor stretches by extending your arm with your palm facing up and gently pulling back on your fingers. Use a resistance band for gentle wrist extensions.
Cooldown: Perform static stretching for the forearm and elbow area.
common_mistakes: Overexerting the muscles, causing discomfort.
Neglecting to stretch properly, leading to stiffness.
Using improper posture during exercises.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you perform stretches and inhale as you return to the starting position.

data.title: Thumb Pain
instructions: Warm-Up: Gently move your thumb in all directions and perform light gripping motions.
Targeted Exercises: Stretch the thumb by pulling it gently away from the hand with the opposite hand. Perform resistance exercises using a rubber band looped around the thumb and fingers.
Cooldown: Massage the base of the thumb and perform static stretches to reduce tension.
common_mistakes: Overstretching the thumb, leading to strain.
Skipping warm-ups, causing stiffness.
Ignoring discomfort during exercises.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe evenly and deeply during each exercise. Avoid holding your breath during thumb stretches.

data.title: Back Mistake Causes Acute Back Pain
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle pelvic tilts and back stretches to prepare your lower back muscles.
Targeted Exercises: Engage in cat-cow stretches, standing back extensions, and child’s pose stretches to alleviate pain and improve flexibility.
Cooldown: End with deep breathing and static stretching of the hamstrings and lower back.
data.focus_area: Lower Back, Lumbar Spine, Core Muscles
common_mistakes: Skipping warm-up, which increases the risk of strain.
Overextending the back during exercises, causing more pain.
Using incorrect posture while performing stretches.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale during stretches, inhale during relaxation phases, and maintain a steady rhythm.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with gentle shoulder rolls and light stretching to prepare the area.

Targeted Exercises: Perform wall angels to engage the shoulder and upper back. Stand with your back against a wall, raise your arms to form a 'W,' and slide them up to a 'Y' shape. Hold each position for 5-10 seconds.
Cooldown: Stretch the shoulders and upper back with a cat-cow yoga pose or child's pose. Hold each stretch for 20-30 seconds.
common_mistakes: Poor posture during exercises: Keep your back straight and aligned.
Overexertion: Avoid pushing through severe pain; focus on controlled movements.
Skipping warm-up or cooldown: This increases the risk of strain.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale during relaxed positions, exhale during effort or stretching, and maintain steady breathing throughout.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Do light arm swings and neck stretches to mobilize the area.

Targeted Exercises: Use a resistance band to perform rows. Anchor the band at chest level, hold both ends, and pull back while squeezing the shoulder blades together. Hold for 2 seconds and release slowly.
Cooldown: Finish with shoulder and back stretches, such as threading the needle yoga pose.
common_mistakes: Using momentum: Avoid jerking movements; maintain control.
Neglecting shoulder blade engagement: Focus on proper technique.
Holding your breath: Remember to breathe consistently.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you pull or stretch, inhale as you return to the starting position.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 3
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle side stretches and neck rotations to loosen muscles.

Targeted Exercises: Try scapular push-ups. Begin in a plank position, keeping your arms straight, and lower your chest slightly by retracting your shoulder blades. Return to the starting position. Repeat 8-10 times.
Cooldown: End with a forward fold stretch or seated spinal twist to release tension.
common_mistakes: Sagging hips during push-ups: Maintain a straight line from head to heels.
Overstretching: Stop if you feel sharp pain.
Skipping rest: Allow enough recovery between sets.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe out as you lower, inhale as you rise, and maintain rhythm.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 4
instructions: Warm-Up: Use a foam roller to gently massage the upper back.

Targeted Exercises: Perform thoracic rotations. Sit on the floor with your legs crossed, place one hand behind your head, and rotate your upper body toward the opposite side. Hold for 5 seconds and repeat on the other side.
Cooldown: Finish with a doorway chest stretch to open the shoulders and upper back.
common_mistakes: Twisting too far: Keep movements within a comfortable range.
Slouching: Sit upright to maintain proper alignment.
Neglecting both sides: Ensure balanced repetitions.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale to prepare, exhale as you rotate, and keep breaths deep and steady.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 5
instructions: Warm-Up: Stretch gently with cat-cow yoga poses to prepare the back.
Targeted Exercises: Perform a seated shoulder blade squeeze. Sit with your back straight, squeeze your shoulder blades together, and hold for 5 seconds. Repeat 10 times.
Cooldown: Stretch the shoulders by clasping your hands behind your back and lifting them slightly. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
common_mistakes: Shrugging shoulders: Keep them relaxed during exercises.
Holding tension in the neck: Focus on keeping the neck neutral.
Skipping repetitions: Consistency is key for relief.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you squeeze, inhale as you release, and avoid shallow breaths.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 6
instructions: Warm-Up: Do slow shoulder rolls and gentle upper back stretches.
Targeted Exercises: Try seated rows using a resistance band. Sit with your legs extended, wrap the band around your feet, and pull back while squeezing your shoulder blades. Return slowly.
Cooldown: Perform a gentle side stretch by reaching one arm overhead and bending to the opposite side. Hold for 20-30 seconds per side.
common_mistakes: Using too much resistance: Choose a band with manageable tension.
Rounding the back: Keep it straight during the exercise.
Rushing movements: Perform slowly for maximum benefit.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you pull the band, inhale as you return, and keep breaths steady.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 7
instructions: Warm-Up: Begin with light cardio movements like shoulder rolls or gentle arm swings to prepare the back muscles.

Targeted Exercises: Perform scapular squeezes by pulling your shoulder blades together and holding for 5 seconds. Stretch by crossing one arm over your chest and holding it with the other hand for 20-30 seconds. Do gentle side bends to stretch the sides and back.
Cooldown: Finish with deep breathing and a forward fold stretch to relax the back and shoulders.
common_mistakes: Overarching the Back: Avoid excessive bending that could strain muscles.
Skipping Warm-Up: May result in stiff muscles and increased pain.
Holding Breath: Maintain consistent breathing during stretches and exercises.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe deeply and rhythmically, exhale during stretches, and avoid shallow breaths.

data.title: Back Pain Below Shoulder 8
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle neck rolls and shoulder shrugs to loosen the upper back and neck.

Targeted Exercises: Do wall angels by standing with your back against a wall and moving your arms up and down in a slow, controlled manner. Stretch by clasping your hands behind your back and lifting slightly to open the chest and shoulders.
Cooldown: End with a seated forward fold to stretch the back and hamstrings.
common_mistakes: Using Excessive Force: Avoid pushing stretches too far, which can lead to discomfort.
Rushed Movements: Perform exercises slowly to ensure effectiveness.
Neglecting Proper Posture: Maintain a straight back during exercises.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply before each stretch, and exhale as you move into the stretch to deepen it.

data.title: Back Pain Between Shoulder 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with gentle arm swings and neck stretches to activate the back muscles.
Targeted Exercises: Perform cat-cow stretches to mobilize the spine. Do a thoracic twist by sitting upright and twisting gently to each side, holding for 15-20 seconds.
Cooldown: Finish with a child's pose stretch to relax the back and shoulders.
common_mistakes: Holding Twists Too Long: Keep movements dynamic rather than static to avoid stiffness.
Skipping Warm-Up: Leads to poor mobility during exercises.
Forgetting to Align Spine: Ensure the back is straight during exercises.
data.breathing_tips: Coordinate breath with movement, inhaling as you prepare and exhaling during stretches.

data.title: Back Pain Between Shoulder 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Do shoulder rolls and gentle side-to-side neck stretches to loosen the upper back.
Targeted Exercises: Perform seated rows with resistance bands to strengthen the back. Stretch by clasping your arms overhead and gently leaning to each side.
Cooldown: Relax with a cross-legged seated stretch, focusing on deep breathing.
common_mistakes: Using Improper Resistance: Start with light resistance to avoid strain.
Overextending: Avoid overextending arms during stretches.
Neglecting Balance: Ensure equal attention to both sides of the back.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale through the nose, and exhale deeply through the mouth during exercises.

data.title: Back Pain Between Shoulder 3
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform light torso rotations and arm circles to increase circulation.
Targeted Exercises: Use a foam roller on the upper back to release tension. Stretch by lying on your back and pulling one knee toward the opposite shoulder.
Cooldown: Conclude with deep breathing and a supine twist to relax the spine.
common_mistakes: Incorrect Foam Roller Usage: Avoid rolling too quickly; focus on slow movements.
Skipping Target Areas: Ensure all sections of the upper back are addressed.
Forgetting Cooldown: Missing this step can result in stiffness.
data.breathing_tips: Maintain consistent breathwork; exhale fully as you release tension with the foam roller.

data.title: Back Pain Relief
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with a gentle cat-cow stretch to mobilize the spine.
Targeted Exercises: Perform a seated spinal twist on each side, holding for 10-15 seconds. Stretch your hamstrings by reaching for your toes while sitting.
Cooldown: End with child's pose and deep breathing to relax the lower back.
common_mistakes: Overstretching: Avoid reaching too far if muscles feel tight.
Rushing Stretches: Hold each position to maximize relief.
Skipping Warm-Up: Can result in ineffective pain relief.
data.breathing_tips: Take deep, calming breaths throughout; inhale as you prepare, and exhale as you stretch.

data.title: Back Will Feel Light
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle arm swings and torso twists to engage the back muscles.
Targeted Exercises: Do bridge poses to strengthen the lower back and glutes. Stretch by reaching your arms forward in a child's pose for 15-20 seconds.
Cooldown: Relax with a deep forward fold and focused breathing.
common_mistakes: Holding Breath: Maintain consistent, deep breathing.
Skipping Strengthening: Ensure the bridge pose is included for maximum benefit.
Rushing Cooldown: Allow adequate time for relaxation.
data.breathing_tips: Take deep, calming breaths throughout; inhale as you prepare, and exhale as you stretch.

data.title: Cross Hand Back
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle back stretches, like cat-cow pose, to loosen up your spine.
Targeted Exercises: Cross your arms and gently stretch your back by leaning forward while keeping your arms in position. Hold for 10-15 seconds.
Cooldown: Slowly return to an upright position and perform light back rotations to release tension.
common_mistakes: Rounding the lower back excessively: Maintain a neutral spine during the exercise.
Skipping the warm-up: Increases the risk of strain.
Holding breath: This reduces oxygen flow and can increase tension.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply before bending and exhale as you move into the stretch. Maintain steady breathing throughout.

data.title: Hips And Back Relief
instructions: Warm-Up: Do gentle hip circles to prepare the area for stretching.
Targeted Exercises: Sit on the floor, bring one leg over the other, and gently twist your torso towards the top leg. Hold for 10 seconds.
Cooldown: Return to a neutral position and perform a seated forward bend for a full stretch.
common_mistakes: Twisting too forcefully: This can strain the spine.
Holding the stretch for too long: Keep within the recommended time.
Ignoring alignment: Ensure hips remain grounded.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply before the twist and exhale as you move into the stretch. Maintain even breathing.

data.title: Hips And Lower Back Pain
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform cat-cow stretches to mobilize the spine and hips.
Targeted Exercises: Lie on your back and pull one knee towards your chest. Hold for 15 seconds and switch sides.
Cooldown: Perform a gentle child’s pose to relax your lower back.
common_mistakes: Pulling the knee too forcefully: Avoid overextending the hip joint.
Skipping the warm-up: This increases stiffness and discomfort.
Incorrect posture: Ensure the back remains flat against the floor.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you bring the knee towards your chest and inhale when switching sides.

data.title: Humpback 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle neck rolls to release tension in the upper back.
Targeted Exercises: Stand or sit upright, clasp your hands behind your head, and gently push your head back against your hands. Hold for 5 seconds.
Cooldown: Lower your arms and perform shoulder shrugs to relax.
common_mistakes: Pushing too hard: Apply gentle pressure only.
Neglecting posture: Keep your back straight.
Skipping cooldown: This may result in residual tension.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply before applying pressure and exhale while holding the position.

data.title: Humpback 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Stretch your arms overhead to lengthen your spine.
Targeted Exercises: Sit or stand, clasp your hands behind your back, and lift them slightly while squeezing your shoulder blades together. Hold for 10 seconds.
Cooldown: Relax your arms and perform gentle arm swings.
common_mistakes: Overarching the back: Focus on shoulder movement.
Holding breath: Maintain regular breathing.
Skipping the warm-up: Leads to stiffness and limited range.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you lift your arms and inhale as you lower them.

data.title: Humpback 3
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform shoulder rolls to loosen up.
Targeted Exercises: Lie on your stomach, place your hands by your shoulders, and gently lift your chest while keeping your hips on the ground. Hold for 5-10 seconds.
Cooldown: Lower yourself slowly and perform a child’s pose.
common_mistakes: Lifting too high: Avoid straining the lower back.
Rushing: Perform movements slowly for control.
Skipping cooldown: Increases residual tension.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you lift your chest and inhale as you lower yourself back down.

data.title: Humpback 4
instructions: Warm-Up: Do gentle back extensions while seated to prepare.

Cooldown: Return to a neutral position and perform light forward bends.
common_mistakes: Arching too far: Avoid overextending the spine.
Skipping warm-up: Leads to stiffness and discomfort.
Holding breath: Maintain steady breathing throughout.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale as you arch your back and inhale as you return to neutral.

data.title: Humpback 5
instructions: Warm-Up: Begin with light shoulder rolls and neck stretches to loosen up the upper body.

Targeted Exercises: Perform wall angels by standing against a wall and moving your arms up and down in a controlled motion. Engage your core and keep your back flat against the wall. Do chin tucks by gently pulling your head back to align with your spine, holding for 5-10 seconds.
Cooldown: Stretch your chest muscles by clasping your hands behind your back and gently pulling your arms upward. Hold for 20-30 seconds.
common_mistakes: Arching the lower back during exercises: Maintain a neutral spine.
Overstraining the neck: Perform movements gently to avoid additional tension.
Skipping Warm-Up: Can lead to stiffness and reduced mobility.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale during relaxation phases, exhale during exertion. Keep breathing steady to support posture correction.

data.title: Humpback 12
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle neck stretches and shoulder rolls to loosen the upper back area.

Targeted Exercises: Use a foam roller along the upper spine, lying flat and gently rolling back and forth. Perform cat-cow stretches on all fours to improve flexibility in the spine. Practice wall angels by standing against a wall and moving arms in a controlled manner.
Cooldown: End with static stretches, focusing on the thoracic spine, and practice deep breathing to relax the muscles.
common_mistakes: Overarching the back during stretches can cause strain.

Using incorrect posture during exercises.

instructions: Warm-Up: Begin with light neck rotations and shoulder shrugs to mobilize the upper back.

instructions: Warm-Up: Perform arm swings and light shoulder rolls to activate the upper body.

Rushing through exercises, leading to improper alignment.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale during exertion, inhale during relaxation phases, and maintain a steady rhythm.

data.title: Humpback 16
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform dynamic arm swings and light chest stretches to prepare the thoracic area.
Targeted Exercises: Use resistance bands for scapular retractions. Engage in seated rows to strengthen postural muscles. Perform thread-the-needle stretches for improved thoracic flexibility.
Cooldown: End with static stretches focusing on the upper back and gentle breathing exercises.

Using improper form during resistance exercises.
Overstretching, which can strain muscles.

data.title: Humpback 17
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle back stretches and rotations to prepare the spine and shoulders for movement.

Targeted Exercises: Stand or sit upright. Roll your shoulders backward in a slow, controlled motion for 10-15 repetitions. Follow with chin tucks: gently draw your chin toward your neck and hold for 5 seconds. Perform wall angels: stand with your back against a wall, arms at 90 degrees, and slide your arms up and down while maintaining contact with the wall.
Cooldown: Stretch the upper back and shoulders with a cat-cow stretch or child’s pose for 20-30 seconds each.
common_mistakes: Hunching Shoulders: Avoid letting shoulders creep up during exercises.
Overarching the Back: Maintain a neutral spine during movements.
Rushing Through Exercises: Perform all movements slowly and deliberately.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale during relaxation phases and exhale during exertion. Keep breaths steady and deep.

data.title: Humpback 18
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with light neck stretches and shoulder shrugs to release tension.

Targeted Exercises: Perform seated rows using a resistance band. Sit upright, loop the band around your feet, and pull it toward you while squeezing your shoulder blades together. Follow with reverse flys using light weights or no weights: hinge forward at the hips, arms hanging down, and lift them outward like wings.
Cooldown: Stretch the upper back with a doorway stretch: place your hands on either side of a doorway and gently lean forward.
common_mistakes: Using Excessive Weight: Stick to light resistance to maintain proper form.
Neglecting Posture: Keep the back straight and shoulders relaxed.
Shallow Breathing: Focus on deep, steady breaths.
data.breathing_tips: Synchronize your breath with movement: exhale during effort, inhale during relaxation.

data.title: Humpback 19
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform gentle spinal twists and shoulder rolls for 1-2 minutes.

Targeted Exercises: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat. Perform a pelvic tilt by flattening your lower back against the floor and then relaxing. Repeat 10 times. Next, do prone cobras: lie face down, lift your chest slightly off the ground while keeping your neck neutral, and squeeze your shoulder blades together. Hold for 5 seconds.
Cooldown: End with child’s pose or a gentle upper back stretch, holding for 20-30 seconds.
common_mistakes: Lifting the Neck Too High: Keep your neck in line with the spine.
Relying on Momentum: Use slow, controlled movements.
Skipping the Cooldown: Always stretch to relax the muscles.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale during effort phases and inhale during relaxation. Maintain a smooth and natural breathing rhythm.

data.title: Humpback 20
instructions: Warm-Up: Loosen up with light spinal rotations and dynamic arm swings.

Targeted Exercises: Perform scapular squeezes: sit or stand with a straight back, squeeze your shoulder blades together, and hold for 5 seconds. Follow with seated lat pulls: sit upright, clasp hands together, and mimic a lat pull motion while focusing on engaging your upper back.
Cooldown: Stretch the back and shoulders with a cross-arm stretch: pull one arm across your chest and hold for 15-20 seconds per side.
common_mistakes: Using Excessive Force: Avoid straining the muscles during squeezes.
Holding Breath: Keep breathing smoothly and naturally.
Poor Posture: Sit or stand upright throughout the exercises.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale during contractions and inhale when releasing. Focus on steady, controlled breathing.

data.title: Humpback 21
instructions: Warm-Up: Begin with cat-cow stretches to mobilize the spine and shoulders.

Targeted Exercises: Stand against a wall with your back flat. Perform wall slides: raise your arms upward, keeping them in contact with the wall, then lower them slowly. Follow with chin tucks and shoulder retractions to strengthen posture.
Cooldown: Use a foam roller or gently stretch the upper back with a seated forward fold.
common_mistakes: Arching the Back: Keep your back flat against the wall.
Rushing Movements: Perform all exercises slowly and deliberately.
Neglecting Alignment: Ensure your head and spine are in a neutral position.
data.breathing_tips: Maintain steady breathing. Inhale during preparation phases and exhale during exertion.

data.title: Improve Posture 1
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with gentle neck rolls and shoulder shrugs to prepare the body.

Targeted Exercises: Sit or stand straight and engage in a chin tuck exercise by gently pulling your chin back, aligning your ears with your shoulders. Perform wall angels by standing against a wall and sliding your arms up and down while keeping your back flat. Stretch your upper back by clasping your hands in front of you and rounding your shoulders.
Cooldown: Finish with seated forward bends and deep breathing to release tension.
common_mistakes: Slouching: Maintain a neutral spine during all exercises.
Overarching the Back: Avoid overcompensating by arching excessively.
Neglecting Breathing: Ensure consistent breathing throughout movements.
data.breathing_tips: Exhale during stretches and inhale when returning to the starting position. Maintain steady, deep breaths throughout.

data.title: Improve Posture 2
instructions: Warm-Up: Perform arm circles and side stretches to loosen up.

Targeted Exercises: Engage in seated cat-cow stretches by alternating between arching and rounding your back. Perform shoulder blade squeezes by pinching your shoulder blades together and holding for a few seconds. Stretch your chest by placing your hands on a wall and leaning forward gently.
Cooldown: End with deep breathing and gentle torso twists.
common_mistakes: Rushing Movements: Perform exercises slowly and deliberately.
Ignoring Alignment: Keep your neck and spine aligned.
Overstretching: Avoid pushing your body beyond a comfortable range of motion.
data.breathing_tips: Synchronize your breathing with movements. Inhale as you prepare and exhale during exertion.

data.title: Improve Posture And Increase Flexibility
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with light dynamic stretches like spinal twists and arm swings.

Targeted Exercises: Perform a downward dog stretch to elongate your spine and hamstrings. Practice seated forward bends to stretch your lower back and hamstrings. Engage in side-lying thoracic rotations to improve spinal mobility.
Cooldown: Relax in a child’s pose and focus on deep breathing to release tension.
common_mistakes: Holding Your Breath: Focus on breathing through each movement.
Collapsing the Core: Engage your abdominal muscles for support.
Forcing Flexibility: Stretch only as far as your body allows comfortably.
data.breathing_tips: Use diaphragmatic breathing to enhance relaxation and flexibility. Inhale deeply and exhale slowly during stretches.

data.title: Increase Pelvic Flexibility
instructions: Warm-Up: Begin with hip circles and leg swings to activate the pelvic area.

Targeted Exercises: Practice seated butterfly stretches by bringing your feet together and gently pressing your knees down. Perform pigeon poses on each leg to open up the hips. Engage in pelvic tilts by lying on your back and alternating between arching and flattening your lower back.
Cooldown: Finish with deep breathing and a happy baby pose to relax the pelvis.
common_mistakes: Straining the Lower Back: Keep your movements controlled and avoid overextending.
Uneven Stretching: Ensure equal focus on both sides of the body.
Skipping Warm-Up: Cold muscles can lead to strain or discomfort.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe into the stretch, focusing on expanding your abdomen as you inhale and softening as you exhale.

data.title: Kyphosis 1

Targeted Exercises: Perform wall angels by standing with your back against a wall, raising your arms slowly to form a 'Y' shape, and then returning to the starting position. Practice seated thoracic extensions by placing your hands behind your head and gently arching your upper back over a chair.
Cooldown: Finish with deep breathing and child’s pose to relax the spine and surrounding muscles.

common_mistakes: Using momentum instead of controlled movements: This reduces the effectiveness of the exercise.
Skipping Warm-Up or Cooldown: Can lead to stiffness and limited mobility.

data.breathing_tips: Breathe deeply and rhythmically; inhale during the preparation phase and exhale during the movement phase.

data.title: Relax And Reduce Back Pain
instructions: Warm-Up: Start with gentle spinal mobilizations and breath-focused movements.
Targeted Exercises: Perform gentle stretches for the lower back and hamstrings to release tension.
Cooldown: Finish with a relaxation technique such as deep breathing or a lying twist.
common_mistakes: Overexerting: Move at a slow, controlled pace to prevent aggravating the pain.
Neglecting the breath: Always focus on steady, rhythmic breathing to aid in relaxation.
Skipping cooldown: A proper cooldown is crucial to avoid stiffness later.
data.breathing_tips: Inhale deeply during relaxation phases, exhale as you deepen stretches.

data.title: Relieve Back

common_mistakes: Performing exercises too quickly: Take your time to ensure proper form.
Neglecting the spine’s alignment: Focus on maintaining neutral spine positions during exercises.
Skipping the cooldown: A proper cooldown prevents stiffness and reduces pain.
data.breathing_tips: Breathe deeply through the nose; exhale slowly as you stretch deeper.
